archimate:BusinessObject.name: Job Execution Step
archimate:BusinessObject.documentation:
A Job Execution Step is a sub-process of a Job, occuring at a particular Station (TBD, 0.4.1), for a particular Product Batch. It has precise start and end time-stamps. A Process Event must occur within a single Job execution step. A Deviation can optionally relate to a Single Job Execution Step.
The Job Execution Step was introduced in v0.4.1 of the PROCESS CDM to bridge the gap between Job Order, Process Events, Batch and Deviation, based on the assumption that a Job Order can span multiple batches.
Formally, prior to 0.4.1 this gap was filled by "Production Run" which was defined as:
"the single execution of a Recipe that results in a Batch of Product (Type). It inherits all the properties of a Recipe, including Machine Configuraiton, Production Sequence, Bill of Material, and the People involved in the Production Run."
